input: Anne is cold. Anne is not kind. Anne is not nice. Anne is red. Anne is young. Fiona is not cold. Fiona is kind. Fiona is young. Gary is red. Harry is kind. Harry is nice. Harry is red. All big things are nice. If something is cold and not red then it is nice. All cold, big things are not white. All nice things are big. If Gary is red and Gary is young then Gary is big. All kind, white things are not young. All red things are young. Big, white things are young. If something is nice then it is cold. Question: Gary is white.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Cold Anne
axiom T2 : ¬ Kind Anne
axiom T3 : ¬ Nice Anne
axiom T4 : Red Anne
axiom T5 : Young Anne
axiom T6 : ¬ Cold Fiona
axiom T7 : Kind Fiona
axiom T8 : Young Fiona
axiom T9 : Red Gary
axiom T10 : Kind Harry
axiom T11 : Nice Harry
axiom T12 : Red Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Nice x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ ¬ Red x → Nice x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ Big x → ¬ White x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Big x
axiom R5 : Red Gary ∧ Young Gary → Big Gary
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ White x → ¬ Young x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Young x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Big x ∧ White x → Young x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Cold x

theorem gary_is_white : White Gary :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Gary is not white

theorem not_gary_is_white : ¬ White Gary :=
begin
  apply R3 Gary,
  split,
  apply R9,
  apply R1,
  apply R5,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R7,
  exact T9,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
